intro: Pseudoboivinella subverticillata, commonly known as the clustered false boivinella, is a rare and specialized member of the Rhamnaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and distinctive inflorescences that bear tiny, greenish-white flowers. The plant is typically found in specific microhabitats, often in shaded, moist environments within temperate regions. Its morphology reflects adaptations to its ecological niche, with features such as reduced leaf size and compact growth forms. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
